name: Hilton Garden Inn Birmingham Brindleyplace

reviews.text: Excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the City Inn

likes.disliked: — The restaurant is excellent; with some unique menu choices.

reviews.text: Also, the restaurant is a real gem. Great service, great food. Our group had some questions and the chef came out to meet with us.
reviews.title: Minor improvements required

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean and in an excellent location.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel with really nice staff to go with it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a Saturday night because of good location next to the NIA. Staff friendly and trying to do their best but long queues at check in, breakfast and checkout.
reviews.title: Location excellent but hotel could do better.

reviews.text: Ate in the City Cafe - food good but service far too slow. They should open earlier for those wanting to eat before concerts etc. It was clear to me that they cannot cope with the numbers when the hotel is full.
reviews.title: Decent enough for quick business trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: really nice, very comfy bed, excellent shower and towels, great TV;
reviews.title: Very very comfortable, good service, bit out of centre

reviews.text: Service: excellent
reviews.title: Great value, clean elegant hotel

reviews.text: Location: its slightly out of the centre, but in a very nice 'new area' by the canal. Its 2 seconds off Broad Street which seems to be the major bars and clubs street.
reviews.title: Can't fault it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the City inn, Birmingham for 3 nights while I was at a conference at the ICC in Birmingham. The hotel was ideally placed in relation to both the ICC and Brindley place (where most of the nightlife/ restaurants are). One point to be noted ladies- the route to the ICC from the hotel is cobbled- Very charming but don't wear your best heels! The hotel itself is elegant, minimally decorated and clean. The bathroom in my room was bright, airy and spotless, with anti fog mirrors which is a nice touch. The room I was staying in had an I mac in it (nice piece of kit!) which had all freeview channels radio etc. I was also supplied with white company toiletries and a bathrobe. I must say I was quite surprised by the facilities in the room considering I was in a standard room that averaged £110 a night. I have stayed in far more expensive hotels that have come nowhere near this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I ordered room service which was ok. The Thai sweet potato and chickpea curry was a bit of a disappointment. It tasted nice but only had about 5 chickpeas in it and was more like rice with sauce. For £8.95 it was expensive but I guess room service is anyway! The breakfast however was really great. Full range of continental style breakfast and cooked breakfast to order. Much better than hot buffet breakfast as it was fresh, warm and delicious. You can even get Stornaway black pudding!
reviews.title: fab for a night out

reviews.text: I booked this at £59 including breakfast.You do have to pay an extra £12 for parking underneath the hotel however .The rooms are new,spotlessly clean and are all very well presented and equipped.I found the original room i stayed in was too noisy due to a noisy air vent.I was moved to a quieter room with no fuss, immediately upon phoning reception.The breakfast was also excellent ,the service speedy and efficient and given the size of the hotel and the number of guests everyhing was run very well.I stay at hotels with work for the major part of the last nine years and can honestly say that it is rare for my expectations to be met.This time they were met fully
reviews.title: Excellent Standard at a Reasonable Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic in every way. Very good price. Excellant service. Lovely modern comfortable room and the mac was a very good touch. I would look no further. Ideal location with bars, restaurants and shopping close by - just perfect.
reviews.title: My 1st choice in Birmingham

reviews.text: Deserves everyone of its 4 stars. I had an amazing deal at £59, the hotel is worth at least £100. Great location, but very quiet inside, really excellent staff, nice airy restaurant and bar, great breakfast, good rooms. Very hard to beat at this level.
reviews.title: Outstanding value, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned today from a 2 night stay booked through Superbreaks, upgraded room and rail travel included.
reviews.title: Don't bother with anywhere else!

reviews.text: The location is excellent- you are in the middle of everything but not disturbed by anything even though Broad Street is a very short distance away.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in the heart of the City. ..
Great location, great prices, great hotel - service could be better
reviews.text: We stayed at the City Inn weekend of the 25th Feb '07 and were very impressed with the place. The rooms were perfectly adequate with DVD player, stereo and nice toiletries (White Company). The day to day staff were a little hit or miss but the management seemed switched on. We had a great rate from the net which included 20% off drinks etc.. Very secure car park under hotel and hotel itself is perfectly located for Birminghams bars and conference centre / REP etc.....Breckie wasn't included but was worth the money to be honest with very nice fry up and good selection of other bits to fill you up for the day. I would reccomend this place to everyone but would ask the management to give their staff a little incentive to be a little more helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Modern Hotel
reviews.text: Very modern clean hotel in a good location for nightlife and all that Birmingham has to offer. Rooms high standrd with dvd player, flatscreen TV and Mini Hi-Fi Unit.
Slightly on the expensive side compared to rivals in the immediate locality (Jurys, Novotel)
reviews.title: A bit dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast good.
reviews.title: Good hotel, fab location

reviews.text: No real negatives
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend the City Inn Birmingham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel looked nice enough online, but we would not stay there again. We were given a smoking room, despite asking well in advance for a non-smoking room. Then we found some suspect brown liquid spilt down the walls in the bedroom and bathroom. On our way out to dinner, we asked the Guest Services representitive to pelase see the room was cleaned while we were out. He apologised and insisted it would be done.
reviews.title: Dirty room and expensive parking
Not as good as last time
reviews.text: On our return later that evening, we found the room untouched. I called Guest Services again, they apologised again and sent someone up. This gentleman insisted he would clean the bathroom wall but not the bedroom wall. When I challenged him on that, he said it is not what he does and he would call his manager.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eventually, manager arrived and finally had the offending areas cleaned.
reviews.title: Room for improvement

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good the next morning. However when we left, we discovered that the promised discount on parking at the neighbouring multi-storey amounted to a mere 10% - overnight parking adding a further £11.50 to our bill - something that was not made clear on their website or when the booking was made.
reviews.title: Disappointing considering the hype

likes.disliked: — Size of bathroom, poor functionality of furnishings, poor service

reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: 4 Stars Is A Little Overstretching It...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided to stay in the Birmingham City inn after an enjoyable visit to the Bristol hotel, the Birmingham hotel offers the same great value and fantastic features that the Bristol hotel presented. Very nice modern rooms, well equipped with home entertainment systems (DVD player and decent Hifi). Spacious bathroom, fantastic shower plenty of room for two.
reviews.title: Modern, clean & enjoyable
Review update
reviews.text: The major concern was the total lack of free car parking, the hotel had a subsidised offer in the local NCP, which almost backed on to the hotel, but the price over a long weekend still broke the £20 mark. Other niggles that made the stay slightly less enjoyable was the checking out process, poor staffing levels on the front desk contributed to a lengthy queue but the swiftness of the staff once being dealt with was very efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please refer to my previous review when reading this update.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.text: I thought it only fair to post an update so that City Inn get a fair overall review from me.
reviews.title: Not my idea of a effortless stay.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I sent an email to David Orr, CEO of the City Inn group at around 2000 hours on the first night of my stay. You can read that mail in my initial review.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed overnight at city inn as had an early fight in the morning.5 pound in taxi to the station with direct link to airport,cooked breakfast as well as continental buffet was included and also i mac entertainment system in room with free internet.rooms were clean and modern and staff very helpful and would highly recommend if staying in birmingham.
reviews.title: comfortable stay

reviews.text: This hotel has put a bit of effort into being slightly different. The rooms are not huge but they are light and clean. The apple mac's that double as your tv in the room are pretty cool. Location is a bit of a walk from town, but there is a new development near it that looks like it could become a main area for bars & restaurants on way into the centre. It is a nice quiet hotel and is a lot better than the ones in the main centre which now look tired and gruby in comparison. Staff were nice. I booked via www.getroomscheaper.com and found a room here for under £70!
reviews.title: Different, clean, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went here for UFC 89. When we arrived it was a quick easy check in. Into the room and was very impressed. Clean, modern, great view and an amazing i-mac tv internet thing which was really usefull when I needed any info. The breakfast was first class, the staff were fine and overall good value for money.
reviews.title: One of the best.

reviews.text: Would recommend here without hesitation.
reviews.title: Clean and modern

reviews.text: Stayed overnight on a business trip. The room was modern and clean, bathroom a bit small but the shower was large. Having an imac in each room was a good idea but the internet seemed particularly slow? We ate in the restaurant in the evening and the food was good but some of the portions were a bit small and the service was also a bit slow, even though it was very quiet. Breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic and gets top marks on all counts.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, stylish, comfortable and in a great location. Very hard to beat.

reviews.text: Firstly the hotel is located in a fab location - Brindleyplace - home to several lovely restaurants. Also Broad Street, with lots of bars and clubs. Getting to the hotel is walkable (about ten/fifteen minutes), but better to get a taxi if you are coming from Birmingham New Street station if you are not familiar with the area, and/or have luggage. It's only a short ride and costs about a fiver.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Onto the hotel itself. It's just perfect. Looks nice from the outside, and even better inside. The large lobby is beautifully designed, with very attractive lounge. The overall style is my favourite type - stylish and modern.
reviews.title: It was a very nice, whole and relaxing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the reception staff to be very friendly, professional, helpful and pleasant to deal with. Check in was a very simple, quick process.
reviews.title: A great place to stay
Downhill since we last stayed but hopefully a one off
reviews.text: My room was nicely sized, with a very comfortable bed, dressed with high quality bed linen. The decor is modern with neutral colours. The bathroom was really nice, with a good, powerful shower. All bedrooms in City Inn hotels have Apple Mac computers installed, which double up as tv's with several freeview/Sky channels. Use of the internet on these computers is totally complimentary. What a fabulous touch! It saved me having to take my laptop with me, and even better still, saved me having to fork out an extra £15-£20 for a day's internet connection, which is what many other hotel brands still do.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Birmingham Brindleyplace Hotel Birmingham
description: Winner of the 2011 TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence The Hilton Garden Inn is a four star standard hotel located in Birmingham City Centre within the prestigous Brindleyplace development. The hotel is centrally located and ideal when attending events and concerts at the International Convention Centre, National Indoor Arena and Symphony Hall or enjoying the shopping and nightlife in and around the city centre. The hotel features 238 queen evolution rooms, the Brindley Lounge, City Cafe, Business Centre and Fitness Centre. All of the rooms are equipped with Apple Imacs which provide a full IT solution for all of your business needs and double up as a comprehensive entertainment system as well featuring a wide range of channels including sky sports. Complimentary wifi is avilable throughout the hotel as well. Sleep Deep, Eat Well, Work Smart, Stay Fit and Treat Yourself are amongst the brand pillars which the team work hard to deliver and ensure that you have a comfortable and successful stay.
